result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Gregory Ward Jr.
Current: 1255 N 44th St, Baton Rouge, LA 70802 United States  (Effective: 06-17-2022)
Prior: 13336 Meadowlane Drive, Baton Rouge, LA 70810

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Takeia H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

03:06 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Anthony Gregory Ward appeared. DE does not qualify for public defender. Court reviews PFAC, questions DE regarding income. Court finds DE qualifies for court-appointed attorney and approves at $100 per month. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. State requests bond. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC and PSC.
